topic.title: Provisioning and De-provisioning

section.title: High Order ODUCn / ODUjk and Low Order ODUjk Multiplexer Datapath Segment Provisioning
section.p: High Order (HO) ODUCn / ODUjk and Low Order (LO) ODUjk multiplexing datapath segments are provisioned with the API g5_api_odu_mux_cfg(). This API is called after the OTUk or OTUCn port has been provisioned, or after the High Order multiplexing datapath segment has been provisioned. When the API g5_api_odu_mux_cfg() is configured as the second stage of ODUjk multiplexing, the LINEOTN interface may have up to 500G of provisioned SERDES ports. If 600G of SERDES ports are provisioned then the second stage of ODUjk multiplexing is unavailable.

Figure 1 shows the datapath segment provisioning for High Order ODUCn or ODUjk multiplexing. Initially the segment is provisioned from the High Order ODUC / ODU framer(A) to the OCPB block(C) and will remain for ODUCn multiplexing or 1-stage ODUjk multiplexing mode. However, if a Low Order ODUjk multiplexing datapath segment is provisioned following the High Order segment provisioning, the datapath segment for the High Order ODUC / ODUk is from the High Order ODUC / ODU framer(A) to the input of the Low Order multiplexer block(B).

fig.title: HO ODUC / ODUk Mux Datapath Segment Provisioning: HO ODUC or ODUjk Multiplexing

section.p: Figure 2 shows the datapath segment provisioning for Low Order ODUjk multiplexing. The segment is provisioned from the Low Order ODU framer(A) to the OCPB block(B).

fig.title: LO ODUk Mux Datapath Segment Provisioning: LO ODUjk Multiplexing

section.title: High Order ODUCn / ODUjk and Low Order ODUjk Multiplexer Datapath Provisioning API Details
section.p: The g5_api_odu_mux_cfg() API provisions ODUjk or ODUCn multiplexing sub-containers ODUjk multiplexing is available for a High Order configured with g5_api_otn_prov() or a sub-container created by calling this API. If this API is used for 2nd stage ODUjk multiplexing, then the LINEOTN Subsystem may have up to 500G of SERDES Ports provisioned against it. If 600G of SERDES Ports provisioned against the LINEOTN subsystem, resources for 2nd stage ODUjk multiplexing are not available. ODUCn multiplexing is available for an ODUCn group configured with g5_api_otucn_group_prov(). 2nd stage ODUjk multiplexing is not allowed on ODUCn multiplexing Low Order ODUk channels. The g5_api_odu_mux_cfg() API parameters are shown below with any associated structures.
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the user defined unique channel ID for ODUj/ODUflex sub-container channel.

The High Order ODUC / ODUk framer channel ID is used for the parent_chnl_id of the API g5_api_odu_mux_cfg() for the 1 stage of ODUjk or and for ODUCn multiplexing. This is the ODU framer marked with 'A' in Figure 1 above. The Mid Order ODUk framer channel ID is used for the parent_chnl_id of the API g5_api_odu_mux_cfg() for the 2nd stage of 2 stage ODUjk multiplexing. This is the ODU framer marked with 'A' in Figure 2 above.

The structure g5_odu_lo_data_t of the API g5_api_odu_mux_cfg() API parameter, info, is used to specify the remaining parameters and options for ODUC / High Order ODUCjk and Low Order ODUjk multiplexing.
The g5_odu_lo_data_t structure's members and associated enumerations are shown below.
The structure member oduk_type uses the enumerated type g5_oduk_t with the values defined inTable 1 below.

entry.p: ODUFlex-CBR, ODUFlex-IMP, ODUFlex-FlexE Aware, PRBS, NULL

section.p: For non-GFP ODUflex rates, the client_bitrate member of the structure g5_odu_lo_data_t of the API g5_api_odu_mux_cfg() must be specified.

The next structure member, client_num_incr, specifies the number of 1.25G tributary slots required to transport the GFP client in ODUflex(GFP). This member is only applicable if oduk_type == G5_ODUK_ODUFLEX_GFP and payload_mode == G5_ODU_LINE_5G_TS. This is required to properly identify the size of the ODUflex(GFP) as a 5G slot can transfer 3 unique ODUFlex(GFP) sizes. For example if the ODUFlex_GFP is 3.75G rate, client_num_incr == 3.
The payload_mode structure member uses the g5_odu_line_payload_t enumeration with the values shown in Table 2 below.

The members tx_tribslot_data and rx_tribslot_data of the structure g5_odu_lo_data_t use another data structure, g5_odu_tribslot_data_t. This structure defines tributary port number and tributary slot assignment for a, ODUCn, FlexO or Low Order ODUk channel. The structure g5_odu_tribslot_data_t has two members, trib_port_number and trib_slot_mask. The member trib_port_number is the transmit port number for the MSI overhead bytes. For ODUjk multiplexing the structure member trib_slot_mask uses its first 80 bits of the first 3 words. In those 80 bits trib_slot_mask[0] 31:0 is used for timeslots 31:0, trib_slot_mask[1] 31:0 is used for timeslots 63:32 and trib_slot_mask[2] 15:0 is used for for timeslots 79:64. For ODUCn multiplexing an array of six 20-bit masks is used to describe which of the 5G tributary slots are being used by the transmit ODUk channel that is being added to the High Order ODUCn group. tx_trib_slot_mask[n] is defined as an index for each ODUC #(n+1) or for each FlexO Interface (100G Port). The 20 bits mask defines bit 0 as 5G time slot 0 and bit 19 as 5G time slot 19.

The last member of the structure g5_odu_lo_data_t is jk_logical_slice. The values for jk_logical_slice are provided by the enumerator g5_cn_mux_jk_mux_instance_t that defines if the ODTUjk MUX/DMX slice selection is explicitly specified or automatically selected using a software algorithm. When assigning the ODUjk MUX slice manually, this enumeration represents logical ODUjkm MUX/DMX slice indexing within a single ODUCn group channel. For example, for ODUC3 <-> ODU2 <-> ODU1 application, this enumeration can be used to assign 1 of the 3 possible ODUjk slices that are available for the ODUC3 group channel. In this case, only G5_CN_MUX_1ST_JK_MUX, G5_CN_MUX_2ND_JK_MUX, G5_CN_MUX_3RD_JK_MUX are the valid options for the Low Order ODU1 to be multiplexing in to the MO ODU2 channel. The logical indexing of a JK_MUX slice cannot exceed "n" of an ODUCn group channel. See Table 3 below for all the values.

entry.p: Logical 1st ODUjk instance within the ODUCn group channel.
Logical 2nd ODUjk instance within the ODUCn group channel.
Logical 3rd ODUjk instance within the ODUCn group channel.
Logical 4th ODUjk instance within the ODUCn group channel.
Logical 5th ODUjk instance within the ODUCn group channel.
Logical 6th ODUjk instance within the ODUCn group channel.

section.title: OTUCn and ODUjk Multiplexing Datapath Segment De-provisioning API Details
section.p: The g5_api_deprov() API is used to de-provision multiplexing datapath segments. The parameters and associated enumerated types are below.
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter of the API is the channel ID for the Low Order ODUk to be de-provisioned.

The enumerator G5_DEPROV_SEGMENT the enumeration g5_deprov_t is used when de-provisioning a Low Order ODUk chnl_id following disconnection at OCPB switch. This API will need to be called a second time to de-provision the MO stage of 2 stage ODUjk multiplexing.

section.p: The following example code demonstrates how to provision a low order ODU2 within an ODU4 channel.
The following example code demonstrates how to provision an ODU4 into an OTUCn group.
